alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Franklin; Kennebec; Oxford; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 4:40PM EST until January 14 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Western Kennebec County in south central Maine... Oxford County in western Maine... Androscoggin County in southwestern Maine... West central Somerset County in west central Maine... Northwestern Cumberland County in southwestern Maine... Franklin County in western Maine... Eastern Coos County in northern New Hampshire... Northeastern Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 545 PM EST. * At 438 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Rangeley to near Fryeburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 71 and 84. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Conway, Berlin, Farmington, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Eustis, Rangeley, Naples, Rumford, Turner, Jay, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Kingfield, Canton, and Andover. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Cumberland; Franklin; Kennebec; Oxford; Somerset
